reviews.review_msg: had for 321 and 426. Grant is one of my favourite professors at SFU. He explains everything really easily, and engages the class really well. He is very straightforward regarding expectations and is genuinely a very nice and relaxed guy.

Chill guy. Great at simplifying concepts + always ready to answer your questions.

1 midterm and 1 final (both non cumulative); rest of grades is online assignments.

Overall, can't complain, he's a really good professor.

Tests are fair; combination of theory and calculations.
Literally does not provide any accommodations, worst prof! Avoid!!
Took for 321. Great prof, exams were very fair, not too challenging but also not too easy. No projects or papers which is nice, just very short weekly assignments and two exams.

Taking him for 321. He is a great professor, the workload is quite light (midterm, final, and weekly assignments that take less than half an hour). He explains everything in simple terms, and provides practice problems that are similar to exam questions. Definetely recommend!
Mr Mowbray seems to genuinely care for his students's wellbeing and encourages them to take on useful challenges which was evident in his courses. Recommended!

Grant was a great professor and made accounting much more easy than I thought. I took it in Summer of 2024 and it was a flipped class where you do all your readings and assignments outside of the class online and then come into class and ask questions. 

His exams were very fair and were very similar to his practice exams. Do those a ton!
Good luck with him

Would recommend taking 251 with Grant, he went over practice problems in class and provided good resources to help with midterm and final. He was also always willing to help after class or via email. Tests were fair and similar to the practice exams. Course content was heavy so make sure you put in time to study each week to do good.

Great guy, great prof. He took an inherently dry subject in accounting and was able to add some personality and humor to it. Not saying the lectures were fun, but they weren't super boring. He does a great job at explaining concepts, and takes lots of time for questions. He also provides lots of resources (practice tests, recorded lecs, etc)

Come to class and do your readings.  The professor is fair but the volume required by this course is enormous.  He tells you at the beginning if you don't have enough time to dedicate to this class, don't take it. This is completely accurate.  If you don't have 6-7 hours a week to dedicate to this class, drop it.
Just listen to the lecture and always practice the questions (no surprised questions in the exams), and you will get a very good grade. He is a nice guy and very cares about his students!
Funny guy. Felt like his rating was too low.
This rating is for BUS  252.
Preparation is key!

Grant does come across somewhat inexperienced as a lecturer and his explanations of topics is sometimes lacking. That said, he is approachable and willing to help. His tests are not easy so expect to put in a lot of preparation.
Amazing professor, was taking accounting for the first time in my life but he made it look soo easy
Amazing professor will always love to take a course with him

BUS251 is a challenging course, alone, but he keeps things light in lectures by using fun analogies. He assigns weekly homework in WileyPlus (you have unlimited attempts to solve problems) and his tutorials are optional to attend, but recommended as the material can be super complicated. His final was almost exactly the same as the practice final.

Clearly very passionate about accounting and willing to answer any questions (without making you feel dumb!) He is always on top of posting course materials and posts recorded lectures so you can effectively cram before exams.

He seems to be a nice person. However he doesn't spend any time to explain things well. He rushes through lectures and finishes in 1-2 hours. This is supposed to be a 3 hour class! His lectures are pretty much useless as he simply reads off the slides. I recommend taking this class with someone else.

Grant is an awesome professor. He is approachable, knowledgeable, and friendly. His lectures are tremendous because he keeps them engaging, and explains concepts well. Assignments and exams were well thought out and explained, so we knew what to expect. I would highly recommend Grant as your next professor.

Grant is a great prof, and is always available if help is needed. It's the course overall that is challenging as so much is covered and tested. Out of all the accounting profs, I'd take another accounting course with him. Tips for exams: go through practice/homework questions over and over again, and memorize ratios and other formulas. Goodluck.
Very clear and to the point with class material always there to try to help students as well

Everyone gives this prof such great reviews, but I am currently struggling in his class. I barely passed the first exam, and everyone said exams would be exactly like the homework, but its not. Its much harder.
